radiographic_examinations.findings: Typical features of herpes simplex encephalitis.
EEG recordings showed right mid to posterior temporal spikes correlated with seizures.
Increased perfusion in the right temporo-parieto-occipital area during seizure.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Comparison with interictal SPECT scans showed localized hypoperfusion.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Tachycardia to the 130s and ejection fraction of 42% with segmental left ventricular dysfunction.
